{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3091077,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-21T21:17:58.666Z","cooked":"

My team is looking to improve the accuracy of our autonomous driving on our West coast drive style chasis.

A lot of teams these days seem to have incredible capability and accuracy off of simply their encoders and gyro.

Our team was okay at it this year but it could be better.

What autonomous drive systems did you use?
What teams did you reference?
Did any other resources help you?
How did it perform?

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Path Planning

Path Planning is the process of creating and following trajectories. These paths use the WPILib trajectory APIs for generation and a Ramsete Controller for following. This section highlights the pr...

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2022-10-21T21:18:51.942Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":112.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":416473,"topic_slug":"how-did-you-construct-your-drive-in-auto","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/pathplanning/index.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Path Planning — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":23}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-did-you-construct-your-drive-in-auto/416473/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3091123,"name":"Tyler","username":"tylerm360","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-10-22T01:32:32.550Z","cooked":"

We used WPILib’s classes for our WCD. We hard coded and tuned the pose values of our paths in the code itself rather than in PathPlanner or Weaver. Our system mostly came from our own interpretation of the WPI classes rather than other teams or resources; the structure we’re using was made before I joined the team.

Our seemingly simple code performed extremely consistently. Our 5 ball was one of the most consistent in our district. I think this consistency was brought primarily by lots and lots of tuning. We spent a lot of time tuning our points on our practice field, and we even had a programmable offset that we tuned during practice matches at our events because the terminal was misplaced on our practice field.

There are definitely areas we are looking to improve for next year (we want to streamline our commands a bit more, etc.), and our code is very messy with some questionable naming/organization decisions, but you can look here if you want to: https://github.com/FRCTeam360/RainMakerXXII/blob/dev/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/autos/TerminalRight/T_R_5Ball.java

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2022-10-22T01:32:32.550Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":126.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":416473,"topic_slug":"how-did-you-construct-your-drive-in-auto","display_username":"Tyler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/FRCTeam360/RainMakerXXII/blob/dev/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/autos/TerminalRight/T_R_5Ball.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51154,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 360 Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/how-did-you-construct-your-drive-in-auto/416473/3","custom_user_title":"Team 360 Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3091942,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-25T19:13:48.928Z","cooked":"

We used WPILib path planning as well, and we were the second highest auto scorer in the state. We had some struggles getting our gear ratio configured right (miscommunication between mechanical and programming.) Start by pushing the robot around and checking your odometry. If odometry is off, everything will be off. In past years we also had trouble with encoders not reading well (or falling off the robot), so check your hardware. We now use Falcons for our drivetrain and we use the built-in encoders. We also found REV’s through bore encoder to be very reliable.

Here is a link to our autonomous routine creation code. We had three different 2-cargo routines, a 4-cargo, and a 5-cargo. Like @tylerm360 we also spent hours running the routines on our practice field and tuning values. We were lucky enough to get nearly an hour on the practice field at our first event as well, which was incredible for tuning.

In the end, even though our odometry was pretty accurate, we have different human player station pose values for our 4-cargo and 5-cargo even though the robot was pulling up to the same spot. With the way the robot was moving we just found those values to work best. We racked up the difference to variances like wheel scrub on our different paths, as well as imperfect ability to place the robot.

For 2023 we’re hoping to take advantage of PoseEstimator and AprilTags to get even better positioning on the field!
